content.rendered:
Well hello there and welcome to Week 9 of This Week in Genesis. This week you all absolutely killed it on new Genesis website releases, so it’s turned into a bit of a showcase special. In fact, there’s a whole lot of inspiration waiting for you below right now, so let’s get to it.

Showcase

We start this week’s showcase with this colourful and completely awesome custom site from Andrea Whitmer for Family Fresh Meals:

Excited to launch a new custom #genesiswp theme for @FamilyFreshMeal – beautiful design from @designeatrepeat. http://t.co/CFtWIr8xYZ

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) June 27, 2015

Meanwhile, Rebecca Gil highlighted a great e-commerce site for Mooshu Trainers made on her Jessica theme:

This cute e-commerce website was made w/ our Jessica theme. Power on #GenesisWP community! http://t.co/BiaoYjf2it pic.twitter.com/PmZzqgIkao

— Rebecca Gill (@rebeccagill) July 1, 2015

A new site for wedding photographer McKenzie-Brown from Patricia Alix Villa:

I love designing wedding photographers' websites! Here's one that just launched. http://t.co/s4lKjppX7E #genesiswp #WordPress

— Patricia Alix Villa (@PatFancyGirl) July 2, 2015

Continuing on a photography theme, Stephanie Hellwig launched a great new Genesis site for photography and artwork studio Sophia Savaughn:

Just launched! #wordpress #genesiswp #photography #webdesign http://t.co/wzvcLN9oxF

— Stephanie Hellwig (@ebizelephant) June 30, 2015

Lisa B launched a great new site MotherGround based on the Flex Pro theme by Simple Pro Themes:

Just pressed 'go' on a new website using Flex Pro theme from @SimpleProThemes http://t.co/pc68qIf4mC #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/FsGpW3ymFe

— Lisa B (@lmbva) June 26, 2015

Finally, I’m not sure it would be a showcase without Vaughan Simons and this week is no exception with a gorgeous site for writer Charlotte O’Leary:

Just launched: a site for comedy drama writer @charlotteoleary, complete with fantastic illustrations by @the_uberpup http://t.co/cGQ62Gemqc

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) June 28, 2015

Podcasts

The UK Genesis Podcast speaks to Richard Senior about startup struggles and financial pain:

We're live! http://t.co/YYuewNbH4r #GenesisWP

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) July 1, 2015

While over on OfficeHours.fm, Natalie Maclees tells Carrie Dils why jQuery isn’t scary:

I’m live in 5 @nataliemac! Watch here http://t.co/y06d9WXmI7 and tag your questions with #officefm

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) July 2, 2015

Articles

Ben Weiser explains Genesis Hooks and Filters to a 5 Year Old:

Explaining Genesis Hooks And Filters To A 5 Year Old #genesiswp #wordpress http://t.co/F1fKBkb0Gx pic.twitter.com/05cVjnFC9E

— Ben Weiser (@benweiser) July 2, 2015

And finally…

The one and only Jesse Petersen has a message for you all:

Your life would be better if you use #genesiswp. I present evidence: pic.twitter.com/4ZTfsndfgd

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) July 2, 2015

PS Did you know 88, yes 88, people subscribe to this stuff every week? Yes, that’s right. And they’ll be 89 once you join them by subscribing for email updates too 🙂
